snippet: History was made on Sunday with 12 fights as women competed in boxing, which was the last all-male sport in the Olympic Games.
abstract: History is made at the Olympics as women compete in boxing, the last all-male sport in the games; USA Boxing, the amateur governing body, had a males-only policy until 1993; the International Boxing Association approved women’s boxing as an Olympic sport in 2009.
lead_paragraph: History was made on Sunday with 12 fights as women competed in boxing, which was the last all-male sport in the Olympic Games.

headline.seo: Women Finally Get Their Chance to Box in Olympics
headline.main: Women Finally Get Their Chance to Be Contenders in Olympic Boxing
headline.print_headline: Women Finally Get Their Chance to Be a Contender
